newsitem.title: USA: Canadian spot natgas drops amid faltering futures.
newsitem.headline: Canadian spot natgas drops amid faltering futures.

text.p: Canadian spot natgas prices moved lower Thursday in response to the sharp loss in NYMEX's June Henry Hub gas futures, industry sources said.
Spot gas at the AECO storage hub in Alberta was quoted at C$1.80-1.84 per gigajoule (GJ), down an average of four cents from Wednesday.
"A lot of it was based on NYMEX. It doesn't make a lot of sense though since storage is still low," one Calgary-based trader said.
NYMEX's Henry Hub June contract plummeted to a low of $2.255 in Thursday's session, down 9.8 cents.
